definition: diaphragm/also written 橫隔膜|横隔膜[heng2 ge2 mo2]

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
(only used in 膈應|膈应[ge4 ying5])

sentences.english: These diaphragms prevent leakage along the valve stem.
sentences.chinese: 这些横膈膜防止了沿着阀杆的泄漏。

sentences.english: I have heard of a few diaphragms blowing out in the bypass valve actuators.
sentences.chinese: 我已经听说过一些横膈膜在支路阀门作动器爆炸。

sentences.english: The diaphragm and other organs engorge with blood, making him look 'pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 横膈膜和其它器官充盈鲜血，令他看来象“怀孕者”。

sentences.english: The upper stem is threaded into the diaphragm retainer nut.
sentences.chinese: 手轮下面是一个六角形外螺纹横膈膜止动螺母。

sentences.english: It is located at chest region above the diaphram.
sentences.chinese: 它分布在胸腔横膈膜以上的部位。

sentences.english: Beneath the handwheel is a hexheaded externally-threaded diaphragm-retaining nut.
sentences.chinese: 手轮下面是一个六角形外螺纹横膈膜止动螺母。

definition: serratus anterior muscle (upper sides of the chest)
sacrum (anatomy)/bone forming the base of the spinal column
rectus abdominis muscle (aka abdominals or abs)
thoracic vertebra/the twelve thoracic vertebras behind the ribcage of humans and most mammals
